page.title: 17Morecambe Carnival.
page.content: The Morecambe Carnival is held once a year in early season and lots of people turn out to watch it. The carnival is a parade of many decorated floats and bands. There are various categories of fancy dress to enter. The parade concludes at Lancaster Road School playing field where there are numerous side shows and stalls. There is also a spectacular air display by the Black Knights. We surveyed some people in Morecambe about the carnival and these are our findings.{ {80% of people liked it; The floats {were the most popular section. Of the {children surveyed 90% liked it.80% {liked the floats and bands. 75% liked {the air display. 95% said they would {welcome another one, saying an {improvement could be made by making {the carnival into a weekend event. }
